alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 12:16PM EDT until May 19 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, Brunswick. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated localized heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Although rainfall has diminished across the area, minor flooding is ongoing across portions of the advisory area. A Flash Flood Warning remains in effect for portions of Brunswick County outside of this Advisory area. Additional localized heavier rain is possible across the Advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oak Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Northwest, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Mill Creek, Supply, Batarora, Varnamtown, Sandy Creek, Bolivia and Brunswick Novant Medical Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
